choices.B: One has a higher potential for disrupting system operations.
choices.D: One returns service banners, including running versions.
choices.A: One uses credentials, but the other does not.
choices.C: One allows systems to activate firewall countermeasures.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST significant difference between intrusive and non-intrusive vulnerability scanning?

discussion.content: An intrusive test tries to exercise the vulnerability, which can crash or alter the remote target. A non-intrusive test tries not to cause any harm to the target. ... A vulnerability scanner such as Nessus (see Nessus) differs from a penetration tool by the manner in which it exploits vulnerabilities.

B. One has a higher potential for disrupting system operations.

A vulnerability scanner can execute intrusive or nonintrusive tests. An intrusive test tries to exercise the vulnerability, which can crash or alter the remote target. A non-intrusive test tries not to cause any harm to the target. The test usually consists of checking the remote service version, or checking whether the vulnerable options are enabled.

choices.B: Increase the password history from three to five.
choices.C: Create an AUP that prohibits password reuse.

discussion.content:
End users are changing their passwords four times on the day the passwords are set to expire. The question is how to prevent users re-using old passwords. 
A. increase or decrease password expiration
B. This is a possible solution, to increase the re-use password to 5
C. This is possible, if users follow the AUP. but sys admins never trusts users anyways and is not a technical control but a policy.
D. Password complexity does not prevent password re-use
I'd choose B

comments.content: I would disagree and choose *A.* Remember they said, "on the day when the password is set to expire they change their password 4 times". If password ageing was active they could not change their password back to back. In addition, if password history wasn't enabled then I could understand why B would be selected however even if they increase the password history you can still get around this.

discussion.content: Agreed. Min password age will prevent them from bypassing the password history policy.
This is confusing, if the password ends each five days they can do the same thing and reuse old pw

B. The answer should be password history not password aging.

The Minimum password age policy setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password can be used before the system requires the user to change it

comments.content:
"The Minimum password age policy setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password can be used before the system requires the user to change it" 
This is exactly what we need in this case. Provided answer is correct.
Agreed. Provided answer will ensure a password age is set to prevent password from being re-set on the same day.

questions.question_text: While reviewing system logs, a security analyst notices that a large number of end users are changing their passwords four times on the day the passwords are set to expire. The analyst suspects they are cycling their passwords to circumvent current password controls. Which of the following would provide a technical control to prevent this activity from occurring?

discussion.content:
NetBIOS provides three distinct services: Name service for name registration and resolution (ports: 137/udp and 137/tcp) Datagram distribution service for connectionless communication (port: 138/udp) Session service for connection-oriented communication (port: 139/tcp)

From https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NetBIOS_over_TCP/IP
Are we supposed to know every and each port number usual assignment?
NetBIOS over TCP traditionally uses the following ports: nbname: 137/UDP. nbname: 137/TCP. nbdatagram: 138/UDP.

questions.question_text: A security analyst is running a credential-based vulnerability scanner on a Windows host. The vulnerability scanner is using the protocol NetBIOS over TCP/IP to connect to various systems, However, the scan does not return any results. To address the issue, the analyst should ensure that which of the following default ports is open on systems?

discussion.content: Botnet is designed to attack during off hours, it is manually controlling from command center. All others are not attacking anytime.

questions.question_text: A senior incident response manager receives a call about some external IPs communicating with internal computers during off hours. Which of the following types of malware is MOST likely causing this issue?

An organization's research department uses workstations in an air-gapped network. A competitor released products based on files that originated in the research department. Which of the following should management do to improve the security and confidentiality of the research files?

comments.content: yes the only way is to accessed an air gaped network is by physically reaching it.

discussion.content: Coz the only way to get into an air gapped network is through removabe media?

Removable USB device can break through air gapped device.
Air gap is for preventing connections from other devices/ networks

comments.content: How do we know it was 1000?

discussion.content: stuxnet hack... some undercover mossad agent snuck in usb drive, took down 1000 uranium centrifuges

choices.B: Configure removable media controls on the workstations.
choices.A: Implement multifactor authentication on the workstations.
choices.C: Install a web application firewall in the research department.
choices.D: Install HIDS on each of the research workstations.
